page.title: 14RECREATION AT TEDSTONE
page.content: Residents go to Clifton or Whitbourne villages to enjoy badminton, football, retirement club, play group, whist, and garden club. There are Women's Institute branches where members take part in craft, drama, choir and a wide range of interest. The British Legion have men's and women's branches at Clifton. There are Scout and Guide troops at Clifton and a Youth Club at Whitbourne. The Clifton branch of the Pony Club is active during school holidays. There are Young Farmers's clubs at Martley and Saltmarshe, members ages range from 10 to 26 years and all interests are catered for. Within the area clay pigeon shooting is popular. There is a well organised syndicate shoot which co-operates in the use of the coverts with the Clifton Hunt whose hounds are kenneled near Tedstone Delamere.
